column2: Axcella Health, Inc. is a biotechnology company, which engages in the research and development of novel multifactorial interventions to support health and address dysregulated metabolism across a broad spectrum of consumers and patients who have limited options. The company is headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts and currently employs 64 full-time employees. The firm focuses on research and development of multifactorial interventions to support health and address dysregulated metabolism across a spectrum of consumers. The company designs and develops endogenous metabolic modulators. Its AXA Development Platform produces a pipeline of AXA candidates with programs in liver, muscle and blood. The Companyâ€™s wholly owned pipeline comprises five programs focused on the metabolic functions of the liver, muscle and blood. The company offers AXA1665 for use in treating Hepatic Encephalopathy; AXA1125 and AXA1957 to treat non-alcoholic fatty liver disease; AXA2678 for use in treating immobilization-induced acute muscle atrophy; and AXA4010 to target multiple biological pathways.
